website_summaries.verdict: The Saucony Guide 8 is a daily trainer that delivers right amount of stability, support and durability. It is a well cushioned shoe that is highly reliable when used for short distance runs and daily training. Some users were happy with the shoe's design and performance but there were also who are disappointed. In summary, the Guide 8 still needs some improvement.
pros: Some mentioned that the Guide 8 is durable
It has reliable grip especially while running on wet surfaces
Many liked the new looks of the shoe
The Saucony Guide 8 provides enough support
cons: Some runners mentioned that the shoe's cushioning is too firm for them
The tongue is annoying because it keeps moving while running
Some runners mentioned that the shoe is too narrow for them

customer_reviews.title: Great running shoes
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my husband who is a big runner. He bought a pair after going to one of the "running" stores in the area and getting fitted. He runs every other day so they wear out quickly. Instead of paying the high price at the store, I checked Amazon and found the same pair. They must have been on sale because I paid around $55 which is a steal! Unfortunately that price isn't still there and I just re-ordered them for $93. Considering how much they are in a store and how much he uses them, it's still a good price. Next time I'm stocking up if they are on sale!
customer_reviews.author: MCS

customer_reviews.title: These Saucony sneakers are great!
customer_reviews.text: I am a college track athlete. I wear these for practice and find them to be very supportive. They are very comfortable. My feet do not hurt after practice. I would recommend them for anyone who runs or anyone who wants supportive sneakers.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Kenney

customer_reviews.title: They are very comfortable and fit is very good
customer_reviews.text: This was my first pair of Saucony running shoes. I have been wearing Mizuno Wave Rider 18's for several months but decided to try this pair. They are very comfortable and fit is very good. Nice cushioning but slightly heavier than the Mizuno's that I have been running in. A very good running shoe that I have been using for treadmill work for a few months now and they show no wear at all. Fit is perfect. I would recommend and would certainly purchase Saucony again.
customer_reviews.author: Keith A

customer_reviews.title: Don't Hold Up To Daily Wear
customer_reviews.text: I am on my feet long hours at work so I wanted something comfortable. These had good reviews and were moderately priced, but that was about the only benefit. After wearing them for 3 months they are already coming apart in the front. I'm not rough on my shoes, just do a lot of walking. It's pretty disappointing they lasted as little as they did. I've had generic $20 shoes last longer than these.
customer_reviews.author: Davin

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes for all-around activities.
customer_reviews.text: Last year, I learned I need shoes in Wide, which are surprisingly hard to find in-store. Also needed shoes that could be worn on a concrete warehouse floor for 6-8+ hrs. Visited a local Fleet Feet and they recommended these. Bought my initial pair from them (in white/blue), then several months later decided to buy another pair (in a darker color), since they work so well. Fits as expected (91⁄2 Wide). I marked these as not providing good arch support, only because I require arch support inserts. Really, you can't expect any good shoe to have perfect arch support for your feet.
customer_reviews.author: Bradford

customer_reviews.title: Nice laces and fits great!
customer_reviews.text: For $60, this was a steal. First set of Saucony's so I'm pretty impressed. Especially the laces, they stretch which is much different than ASICS and Nike's. I would definitely purchase again. I wear 8Ws and these fit perfectly. I also use Superfeet Green insoles because I have Asian foot (wide) and a crappy arch and the Arch support does wonders for my feet and I have 4 pairs of them for different shoes. I would always recommend these insoles for any sneakers. I'm still trying to understand the offset. I got 8mm offsets. Can someone explain this one to me?
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Best model for my Plantar Fasciitis
customer_reviews.text: I loved these shoes since the day I bought my first pair last year. I decided to order more from here because I already knew this model/size fit me perfect. These are the only sneakers that have practically reversed my Plantar Fasciitis. The heel is soft, like a gym mat. I can run for miles without that tell-tall bone spur/PF pain. If I could order a hundred more pairs of these, I would. Why they don't advertise these as beneficial for those of us with chronic PF is beyond me. I just wish this model came in more available colors.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Capron

customer_reviews.title: Saucony Guide 8's: approved.
customer_reviews.text: so far I'm very happy with the Guide 8's. I run about 3 times a week, 3 to 4 miles per run, and have had them for about two and a half months now. The cushioning is really good; I am satisfied with the way it absorbs impacts. They're light and look pretty cool too. They fit me a bit bigger in length (depending on the brand I wear 10.5 or 11). I ordered 11's based on the sizing recommendation (comparing to previous brand and model I had). Despite fitting me a tiny bit bigger, it is not uncomfortable or annoying in any way. I do not feel it in my running at all.
customer_reviews.author: MacB

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes - but I was professionally fitted to them.
customer_reviews.text: I was fitted for these shoes, not the same pair, but he previous pair. This pair was me buying the same kind in preparation for the original pair wearing out. I don't know if everyone agrees, but I think if you run seriously, or at least fairly often (maybe a couple times a week) it is worth going to the running store, get fitted, find an awesome pair, and go from their. I think this design is well suited for my set of running behaviors, but that may not be the same for another person thinking of these.
customer_reviews.author: YS Rider

customer_reviews.title: An  Excellent shoe for walking, running and every day use.
customer_reviews.text: These Saucony Running shoes have replaced my prior favorite shoe for walking; the New Balance 845 series of walking shoes and their evolution of the past five years. I also have a pair that I use as an everyday shoe for 3 seasons and part of winter. So far, I've not experienced any foot or leg issues since I purchased my first pair one year ago. The design and build quality has been excellent. I now have three pair of this model; two Guide 8's, one Guide 9 version.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoe, but the fit is a bit tight
customer_reviews.text: I really like the style and support of these shoes, but the fit is a little bit off. I've had a narrow foot all of my life, and I've always worn a 'D' width, so that's what I ordered. The fit in the front of the shoe across the lower lace is really tight. I had ordered 2 pairs of these but sent one pair back because of this. The other pair I had already worn a little, so I was hoping they'd 'give' a little and relax, but so far they are still tight. I'm not sure if it's this brand of shoe or the particular style that makes them fit like this.
customer_reviews.author: Paul in NC

customer_reviews.title: Solid Shoes
customer_reviews.text: At first, I felt these shoes were slightly narrow across the widest part of my foot. It annoyed me for maybe my first 8 runs but after that I have not noticed any issues. I like these shoes and would recommend them. They have held up very well to a year's worth of running (in comparison to a different brand I had right before these that had the tongue unravel and partially detach from the shoe-upper).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: hmmm...
customer_reviews.text: Not a huge fan of these - I've worn Brooks, Mizuno, Asics, Nike, and Adidas Bounce. These Saucony are better walking shoes than running shoes. I felt the difference right away the first time I ran in these. It feels like they don't have any shock absorbers in them every contact my foot made with the ground I felt it in my legs, it wasn't painful it just didn't feel comfortable. However I do like to walk in these and they look pretty cool
customer_reviews.author: MrBell

customer_reviews.title: Great Runners
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes so far. I'm a big guy and put some damage on the ground when I run. So far these shoes are light and comfortable and stand up to the pounding. I have only been wearing them for a few weeks but I love them so far. I run a few times a week so I need something durable. The color and look is awesome. I'm a fan!
customer_reviews.author: John G

customer_reviews.title: Saucony Men's Guide 8 Running
customer_reviews.text: Love this guide 8 running shoe. I had plantar fasciitis an used this running shoe with no pain. I ordered a second pair in case they go out of production. I highly recommend this shoe I tried a lot of things but they gave me instant relief. I ordered on size larger then normal.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes. I've been wearing these for years and am on my 4th pair in this line. They fit as expected (but I buy all athletic shoes a half size larger than dress shoes, so there's that). I've got flat feet and I overpronate, and these are great for me. They don't have the kind of arch supports that bother my feet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: If you have flat feet, stay away! No support.
customer_reviews.text: The sides of the shoe are weak, the back of the shoe where your heel slides in is very weak, it breaks down too fast, I returned them. No support.
customer_reviews.author: Jcv

customer_reviews.title: Good shoes for running and staying active on your feet ...
customer_reviews.text: Good shoes for running and staying active on your feet all day. The Guide 9 shoes have slightly higher heels (8mm?) and the 10 series sit lower and seem to have a little better back support. All are great shoes and boils down to what fits your feet the best and how much you want to spend.
customer_reviews.author: M. GUERNSEY

customer_reviews.title: If you know your Saucony size, buy the same size of this product.
customer_reviews.text: This is her husband doing the review. I have been wearing Sauconys for work for years. I stand and walk all day. My biggest concern with buying shoes online is fit. These fit the same way as the other pairs (not this specific model) of Sauconys I have owned. In other words, if you know the size of this brand you wear, buy the same size of this product and you will be good to go. I'm not a runner, so I can't comment on them from that perspective.
customer_reviews.author: RedlandsCAfam

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe
customer_reviews.text: I have run off and on my entire life. I just recently started getting into running a lot more. I jogged to work, which is 3 miles at least 2 to 3 times a week. The first 10 to 15 miles I definitely noticed a break in period but after that the shoes have been exceptional. My wife has had a pair of these for about a year. She recommended them and I'm extremely happy. Will definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: My perfect shoe
customer_reviews.text: I've been a huge fan of the Guide line since the second generation. I am on my feet all day, so finding such a comfortable shoe is a big deal. They are perfect for my feet with more arch support than most shoes. I also find that with most shoes, the arch is placed a little to far rearward, being uncomfortable against the front of my heal. I can just order my size in the latest generation Guide and know it is going to fit great.
customer_reviews.author: Keith O'Neal

customer_reviews.title: Less room in the toe
customer_reviews.text: The thing I loved about the Guide Series was the room in the toe box and the support in the arch. The support is still there but it seems like every version gets more and more narrow. Others have said the same thing. I don't know why Saucony keeps messing with the design. I have done 5 Ironman Races. Three in this shoe. I couldn't use them for that anymore. Better go at least 1/2 size up.
customer_reviews.author: Vocalion

customer_reviews.title: Great running shoes
customer_reviews.text: This is a great running shoe. It has very good arch support which was helpful since my son's feet tend to overpronate (lean to the inside). This was my son's third pair of these. They were also very easy to order online in the size you want. You don't have to go back and forth to the store. I highly recommend these shoes for runners.
customer_reviews.author: MK Superpetes

customer_reviews.title: The red ones are ugly as sin but they are extremely comfortable to workout in
customer_reviews.text: I got these off Amazon Warehouse for $30 shipped to my door. The red ones are ugly as sin but they are extremely comfortable to workout in. I no longer leave the gym with sore and aching feet. As a reference point my workout typically consists of using the treadmill and then completing a Beach Body Power 90 routine. Overall I am very pleased with these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Throls

customer_reviews.title: Some of the best sneakers I've owned to date, especially when you consider the price
customer_reviews.text: some of the best sneakers I've owned to date, especially when you consider the price. I get compliments on them all the time and asked where I got them. That I did not expect. I have abnormally high arches and pronation issues and these helped with those issues without the need for any insoles or padding. I'll probably order another pair if they are still available when I wear these out.
customer_reviews.author: crazycrawfish

customer_reviews.title: Get your feet checked.
customer_reviews.text: Prior to purchasing the shoes I had had a string of bad luck with another brand. I went to a running store that checked out my hair, and narrowed my choice down to 2 pairs. The reason I picked up the shoes was they normally run $130 in my area, but they were on sale 70% off on Amazon. I can't pass up a deal like that.
customer_reviews.author: BaldGrimace

customer_reviews.title: Seemed like a great pair of shoes when I bought them
customer_reviews.text: Seemed like a great pair of shoes when I bought them. I've worn Sauconys for many years and have had no problems, until now. I wore them for a couple of months, and then saw that the bottom of the sole was beginning to peel away from the shoe in several places on both shoes. I've never seen this occur before. Maybe a defect. Called Amazon, and even though the shoes were outside the return period they made it right and let me return them for a full refund.
customer_reviews.author: Dry Gulch Ranger

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable shoes.
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable and pretty lightweight. I use these as every day shoes since I have back issues. I never wore Saucony before, and I really like them. No fancy air or springs or other marketing gimmick that fails after a short time. These are traditional-type construction and work great. Will definitely try more Saucony shoes in the future.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Wil try something else.
customer_reviews.text: These are the worst Saucony shoes I have ever purchased. I've had plantar for a while now and my other saucony shoes have been fine. These shoes have made the plantar worse and for 2E they are very narrow. Not pleased with this model at all.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Huang

customer_reviews.title: Great running shoe.
customer_reviews.text: Switched from Nike to Saucony last year. Much softer and lighter feel. Wished I switched years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Support and Cushioning
customer_reviews.text: My ankles are somewhat flimsy and these shoes keep them in place. This is the first time I went with more cushioning, since my old shoes were giving me small blisters in the city after 5+ mile runs. Feels like there's enough cushioning to run on roads, I would just prefer the shoe sole to be softer. Hopefully they will get there, when I put more miles on. Can't compare with the previous (7) or next (9) model, but I like these (8) overall.
customer_reviews.author: Alexey

customer_reviews.title: Small Toe Box
customer_reviews.text: I put these on and immediately took them off and put them back in the box. The toe box is very narrow. I'm size 10.5 and usually buy Saucony so I didn't heed the warning to buy a bigger size. This was the first time I've had to send shoes back. I'm hesitant to try a larger size.
customer_reviews.author: Quackers

customer_reviews.title: Nike Wearer Now LOVES these shoes!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these Saucony's for my husband as he's been a Nike wearer most of his life. He's been wearing them about one month now and loves them. He said they support his arches well, he has wide feet so we procured the wider width version - he said they fit like a glove. The colors are vivid but not overwhelming. he loves them.
customer_reviews.author: Carolee

customer_reviews.title: These are the best running shoes for a narrow foot/arch support that I've ...
customer_reviews.text: These are the best running shoes for a narrow foot/arch support that I've come across. Originally started with the Guide 6, have had the 7's and now the 8's. Fantastic shoe, very comfortable and supportive, and lasts well. Will definitely continue to purchase.
customer_reviews.author: RD

customer_reviews.title: but I’m happy that they are similar enough that I don’t notice ...
customer_reviews.text: I've probably been through about 5 pairs of the Guide 7, so I am extremely familiar with Saucony's Guide series of shoes, and obviously I favor them quite a bit. They offer the support that I need for my minor over-pronation. The Guide 8 seems virtually indistinguishable from the Guide 7. I’m sure if I had two new pairs side by side, I’d be able to tell you what’s different, but I’m happy that they are similar enough that I don’t notice any differences.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Fabian

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: I've been running in Guide's on and off since the first generation. I regularly pick up other models, and even brands, just to see how the other options compare. I keep coming back to these because, at least for me, they offer the best combination of fit and comfort. The construction and wear life is very good too.
customer_reviews.author: JustAGuy

customer_reviews.title: Something wrong with the left shoe..
customer_reviews.text: I am facing pain in the left toe after I started using them. I have used them only 3-4 times for 2+ hour running. I was thinking something wrong with my way of using them but it is happening repeatedly just with these. Still no issues with my old running shoes. Need to return them or they will be sitting on my shelf for long long time.
customer_reviews.author: MP

customer_reviews.title: Feel great and look good.
customer_reviews.text: Feel great so far. Supports my arch and cushions my heel. Look good on also. I am on my feet all day at work, and these have made my feet feel not tired and sore when I get home. They are a little wide for me, though, so must make sure to tighten up the laces so that they fit snugly and support my foot. Otherwise, my feet will still ache at the end of the day.
customer_reviews.author: daw

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and fit perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these shoes for jogging since the beginning of January. They are holding up very well and are still very supportive and comfortable. I am not a light weight person, so I tend to wear out the support pretty quickly on running shoes. I feel I should be able to get many more jogs out of these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes  helped with Plantar Fasciitis pain
customer_reviews.text: Bought the shoes since I read another review helped with Plantar fasciitis. Had the same result do not experience or very little pain wearing these shoes. I have been wearing for a couple weeks and so far so good these are good for the PF and very comfortable. I have inserts for the PF i can not wear them on top of the shoes inserts, but not really needed these have a lot of support and stability.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Vasiliou

customer_reviews.title: I love these shoes
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes, and I do wish that running shoe companies would stop tinkering with a good thing. Every time I find a perfect shoe, they "improve" it to the next version (Guide 9, Guide 10), and somehow screw up what I love about them. But as long as the Guide 8 is on the market, I'll keep buying it! Great shoe, with a perfect fit.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Very much like these shoes
customer_reviews.text: Very much like these shoes. I am a big guy who needs adequate cushioning, some stability characteristics for mild overpronation and this shoe does the job as well as any I have used.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Great looking....Light....Quality
customer_reviews.text: I run a lot...and needed something that looked good, but, also was good for my 'non-running' time as well.... This, is the perfect sneaker.. It is light, it looks REALLY GOOD, and, its VERY COMFORTABLE... The price is excellent... Also, most of my running shoes are SAUCONY.....You cannot go wrong with them..
customer_reviews.author: LA

customer_reviews.title: Does not wear well
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe other than it did not hold up over time. The company replaced the shoe free the first time as it broke down in less than 3 months after moderate usage. After the 2nd pair broke down just as quickly, I switched back to New Balance. Last time I buy a Saucony.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel F Stowell

customer_reviews.title: Fit as Expected?
customer_reviews.text: I've worn Saucony running shoes since 1979 and I've found their designs to be both light, flexible and economical. Fits exactly as expected if by expected you know to order a full size larger than your foot size.
customer_reviews.author: D. Smith

customer_reviews.title: great shoes though
customer_reviews.text: Used for hiking 4 to 5 times a week, did not hold up as well as expected, great shoes though.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Loved them
customer_reviews.text: Lasted a few hundred miles. Fit really well. Very comfortable to run in. Will try to reorder. My feed are flat and wide, and Saucony is the only brand I have found that I can comfortably run in.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Maybe within a few weeks they will feel better. They are the stiffest name brand running shoe ...
customer_reviews.text: Very fast shipping! I've only put a few miles on them so far and they are just okay. Maybe within a few weeks they will feel better. They are the stiffest name brand running shoe i've tried. Not too comfortable, but not terrible. Like I said, maybe once they are fully broke in I will like them much better.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Leonard

customer_reviews.title: and they were not expensive- the competition to these are easily $120+. They work well
customer_reviews.text: I got these because I have moderate pronation, and they were not expensive- the competition to these are easily $120+. They work well, and give me great stability for running on the treadmill and raquetball. My shins/calves feel much better.
customer_reviews.author: The Dills

customer_reviews.title: Buy Saucony running shoes
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes at a great price. I do a lot of walking with my dog and I just have to have a comfortable shoe, for that reason I only buy Saucony shoes. They are well made and last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: steve barron

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic shoes, but I have to use arch support. I have very high arches, so I expected this. People with relatively flat arches, or lower arches probably wont' have this problem. These shoes are light and fit extremely well .... I have very wide feet, so I always order 2E wide shoes. ....
customer_reviews.author: Dystopian Dave

customer_reviews.title: Got a fresh pair for military training camp. My son won't wear any other shoe!
customer_reviews.text: This is my son's fourth pair since high school five years ago. He was having achilles tendon pain and was fitted with his first pair of Saucony Guides by a specialty running shop. The pain improved almost immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Jill B

customer_reviews.title: I'm Back on Saucony and Glad
customer_reviews.text: After a hiatus away from Saucony for a few years, I'm so happy to be back. I grew tired of the Guide a few years ago as they modified the fit, but these shoes fit like a glove for me again. I'm so happy to be back after my tribulations with my last pair of Asics...which were terrible. These are fantastic shoes.
customer_reviews.author: B.M.

customer_reviews.title: These are great shoes! I got fitted for these at a ...
customer_reviews.text: These are great shoes! I got fitted for these at a local running store (I highly recommend this for anyone looking for a new pair of running shoes). I am on my second pair of these and I love them. There is a medium amount of support compared to some other shoes I've run in, the soles are a combination of softer and harder composites depending on what part of the foot it's under.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Beam

customer_reviews.title: I am used to asics and my impression is that these Saucony's are more firm but did not seem to increase knee pain (which I will
customer_reviews.text: I put these Guide 8's on and ran 5 miles w/o any issues. I am used to asics and my impression is that these Saucony's are more firm but did not seem to increase knee pain (which I will feel with poor shoes). 4 stars because I did not instantly fall in love but might revise after broken in. Yes these run at least 1/2 size small but then again so do most asics.
customer_reviews.author: Tim S

customer_reviews.title: Great running shoes
customer_reviews.text: Great running shoes. Fit as expected. I have used the Saucony Guide 7 series for the last year and love them. Decided to try the newer 8 series, and they are just as good. I especially like the color of these red/orange pair as they provide a little style.
customer_reviews.author: StrainTheBrain

customer_reviews.title: Sweet deal
customer_reviews.text: I think it's a great deal I've only had the shoes a few days but they feel great and the price is nice it saved me a trip to the shoe store I just might buy my shoes from Amazon from now on. You really can't go wrong with these at this great price
customer_reviews.author: Joe Jefferies

customer_reviews.title: Good fit / great shoe.
customer_reviews.text: I've only wore this pair once for running so far but they seemed fine. I have owned many pairs of Guide shoes but the previous pairs were size 13. Either you are making your shoes smaller or my feet are getting bigger. Anyway, the 14's are perfect. (I had prreviously owned the Hurricane but they are now prohibitively expensive.)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing quality
customer_reviews.text: Not made to last. With light usage, the fabric at the toe has already separated from the leather/rubber toe piece. Frustrating because Saucony fit my feet better than any other brand I've tried.
customer_reviews.author: Inactive Fred

customer_reviews.title: Old Guide 8 much better than newer Guide 9's
customer_reviews.text: 1/2 size bigger fits well. These Guide 8's are much better than the shoe that replaced it - the Guide 9. Ran my first guide 8's into the ground and loved them. Guide 9's were too narrow in the toe box, and they changed footprint of sole around arch. They hurt my feet. Thankfully shoe store took them back. I am glad I found these older guide 8's. Saucony made a great shoe in this one - then they screwed it up with the replacement.
customer_reviews.author: JEB

customer_reviews.title: Run for Days!
customer_reviews.text: Saucony's Guide running shoe is all I will run in. They compensate well for my pronation issues and plenty of cushion on my feet for long runs. No more shin splints! Buy these shoes!!
customer_reviews.author: Don E.

customer_reviews.title: Hope they keep making these!
customer_reviews.text: I've owned the 6 & 7 versions of this shoe. I have an unusually-high arch and this provide adequate support while running and jogging. After purchasing this model shoe two years ago, I no longer get stress injuries on the bottoms of my feet.
customer_reviews.author: SomeRandomGuy

customer_reviews.title: Great fit!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using Saucony Guides for years now and it's nice to know as long as I buy my size they always fit and are comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: I love Saucony Guide series
customer_reviews.text: I love Saucony Guide series, these are comfortable shoes, but they are NOT durable. The back of the shoes already have holes where my heel rubs against the hard plastic material and are to the point of unusable while running after only 4 months.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good cushion. Need 1/2 size larger
customer_reviews.text: Good cushion & ankle support. Comforable wear for flat foot. However its size is a bit smaller than usual (toe area). I bought 8 US but should buy 8.5 instead.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I started running this last summer and I started with a different shoe. I switched over to this shoe once summer cross country practice started. I put about 300-400 miles on these shoes and they finally gave out on me. I bought another pair and use them currently and they feel great! I would recommend these shoes to anyone that does a decent of road running.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander J. Ragsdale

customer_reviews.title: nice shoe for the price
customer_reviews.text: I bought them for my husband. He loves them. This is his first pair of Saucony and he was very surprised at how light they are. I've been a Saucony fan for many years. They provide great support for overpronators.
customer_reviews.author: Mraff

customer_reviews.title: Continue to love my Saucony's!
customer_reviews.text: This is the third pair of Saucony shoes I have had, and they continue to be awesome! The fit is always good, they're comfortable to wear all day, in all activities, and they're nice and light. I'll for sure buy another pair!
customer_reviews.author: Mark S. Fleming

customer_reviews.title: Have been satisfied with this model of Saucony running shoe
customer_reviews.text: Have been satisfied with this model of Saucony running shoe. I have been using Saucony for more than a couple of decades. Seem to have to best cushion/stability ratio for me.
customer_reviews.author: Ski Suffield

customer_reviews.title: Ouch!
customer_reviews.text: The width was ok for these shoes but the room between my feet and the laces was very tight. The fabric or seam caused a blister on top of the tendon that runs from my instep to my big toe. I have never had this happen before.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas J. Doyle

customer_reviews.title: Makes walking enjoyable again
customer_reviews.text: Great sneakers. I broke my heels years back and I need the 8mm heel to toe. I can walk all day in them. Bought 2 more pairs for extras.
customer_reviews.author: Michael A. Ginesi

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Wore them a few times and gave them away. Just too narrow in the toe.
customer_reviews.author: Randall G. Hauk

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for the price
customer_reviews.text: good light stability shoe for mild over pronators...cant beat the price. I will probably order more of these. I run 2-4 miles a day 5 days a week and sometimes experience post tib tendonitis.
customer_reviews.author: Bert Watkins

customer_reviews.title: Kudo's for Guide 8 's
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe and the fit was perfect. Some of the reviews I read before ordering, were saying they did not like them as much as the Guide 7's. This is the first pair of Guide 8's I have ordered and I would get them again. Great shoe at a good price.
customer_reviews.author: jerryz

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable shoe, sole is wide near the toe box ...
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable shoe, sole is wide near the toe box which is promising for my slightly wide feet. However the fit seemed just a little tight in the same area. I'm thinking the fabric will stretch a little and they will fit perfect. So far so good, I'd recommend them to anyone especially if you have a regular width
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Although this product was labeled 10W like my current shoe
customer_reviews.text: I currently wear this running shoe which I purchased from another source. Although this product was labeled 10W like my current shoe, I cannot get my feet into them without great discomfort. I suspect they are mislabeled. I returned them.
customer_reviews.author: James E Gill

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Shoe came apart the same week I got them so I returned them.
customer_reviews.author: John Davis

customer_reviews.title: look great, nice arch support
customer_reviews.text: As I do on all my Saucony shoes, ordered these 1/2 size larger than I wear in other shoes. They fit perfectly, look great, nice arch support, good motion control, which I need. Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: LarryV

customer_reviews.title: Great running shoes
customer_reviews.text: I needed a new pair of shoes to replace my worn Progrid Guide 5 shoes. These are the latest version. There was really no adjustment period needed at all; I just put them on and ran and they felt like old friends.
customer_reviews.author: The Toxster

customer_reviews.title: Like it was made for my feet!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic shoes! I normally wear a 13 shoe, but that's just because most shoe stores only go up that high, leaving me with tight fitting shoes. I took a chance and ordered a 14 Wide and it's like this shoe was made for my feet! I'm not a runner, but they are very stylish and comfy for weekend wear.
customer_reviews.author: Erik J Petterson

customer_reviews.title: these are a great stability shoe
customer_reviews.text: This is the 4th pair I have ordered for my husband, He loves them! he works in a warehouse & he is a big guy so he needs a new pair every three months, these are a great stability shoe.
customer_reviews.author: R.

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: Guide series are my favorite everyday running shoes (I am a slight over-pronator). With some running shoes you need to order 1/2 size over street shoe size; with these, go 1 full size over.
customer_reviews.author: J. Olivier

customer_reviews.title: Solid shoe
customer_reviews.text: Solid shoe... Doesn't let feet breath as much as others... Feet more stinky/sweaty. Hubby says they are comfortable, able to work full days in them without a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Diandra E.

customer_reviews.title: Saucony stikes again!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my daily walks at work since I needed a high quality shoe for my sore feet and Saucony has never let me down! The quality of these shoes is as expected for Saucony and I know they will last me for 400 or more miles.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Running Shoes
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd pair of these running shoes. I've used them for training, running my first half marathon and for general running and walking exercise.
customer_reviews.author: Larry M

customer_reviews.title: Great Support and Value
customer_reviews.text: Not a big runner. But looking to start again. Averaging just 10 miles a week. But they fell great with a lot of support for my big frame and still a pretty light shoe. And they look great! Size is pretty spot-on.
customer_reviews.author: Charles K Meyers

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe for amateur minimalist.
customer_reviews.text: I am pleased with the product. These shoes nice if you're interested in mid/fore foot striking, with proper support and padding. The 8mm drop is not too large and makes the shoes just right, so you don't feel like your calves and Achilles' tendons are being stretched out like some minimal shoes you may be used to. Check them out.
customer_reviews.author: David Vance

customer_reviews.title: don't buy
customer_reviews.text: The bottom of the shoes started to peel off after using for a 3 months of irregular use on a treadmill. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's a good running shoe, but like all running shoes it depends on your foot and style
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe for my foot, but like with any running shoe it's not going to work for every foot type. If it helps I also like the Brooks Ghost line.
customer_reviews.author: MisterK

customer_reviews.title: WTH
customer_reviews.text: I'm confused, I previously ordered 10.5 M (the correct size I wear) and returned them because they where way to small.exchange for 11 M expecting Saucony must be sized small. My excitement was short lived when they arrived at the house today.. Way to big! Extremely disappointing
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for jogging
customer_reviews.text: will never buy another brand of workout shoes again. Great for jogging, cross-fit, and cardio. I recently bought some brooks and new balance shoes and neither compare to Saucony.
customer_reviews.author: ryan

customer_reviews.title: Saucony Quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought for grown-up Son. He is happy with them. Saucony consistently wears well and fits to size.
customer_reviews.author: raterguy

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable shoes, but run a bit smaller than other running shoes.
customer_reviews.text: Glad I read the reviews before purchasing these shoes. Normally, I wear a size 11 in running shoes, but after reading some reviews stating they run a bit small, I took a chance and went w/ an 11 1/2. Worked out perfect! They fit great and are comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: ScottH

customer_reviews.title: He really likes them.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my husband for his birthday. He really enjoys wearing them to walk in.
customer_reviews.author: K. WILSON

customer_reviews.title: I couldn't ask for a better fit and more comfortable shoe
customer_reviews.text: I am now on my fifth pair of Saucony. I couldn't ask for a better fit and more comfortable shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Cooneyisland

customer_reviews.title: Saucony Guide 8 running shoes run WAY small (1-1.5 sizes)
customer_reviews.text: I bought these Saucony Guide 8 running shoes a half size large, but they were still too small, so I had to return them. There were no options to replace them at my needed size (1 - 1.5 sizes larger than my normal size) and cost.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Lingenfelder

customer_reviews.title: really Like these shoes
customer_reviews.text: really Like these shoes. They are far and above the Asics shoes I have tried; these give far more support. shoes have held up really well.
customer_reviews.author: lance

customer_reviews.title: Glad I did
customer_reviews.text: I switched from the Omni to this. Glad I did. Lighter but still with great support.
customer_reviews.author: Goose

customer_reviews.title: The only kind I wear
customer_reviews.text: These are the only kind i wear. I've been wearing this brand/style for many years. I'm a casual runner and avid walker. These are very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: MissMe

customer_reviews.title: Not as described  10 2E wide
customer_reviews.text: The shoes did not fit. They were too narrow. Did not enjoy and returned the next day. I presently wear a few different size 10 shoes with no problem. This one was not good.
customer_reviews.author: michael galer

product_meta.title: Saucony PowerGrid Guide 8
product_meta.description: The perfect mix of fit and Reaktivität. Every single detail of the Saucony Guide has been refined. With full-length cushioning, a crash pad and a Aufgeweiteten forefoot it is the ideal road running shoe for light Überpronierende runner as well as for the neutral runner looking for extra support.
feature_bullets: * * NEW * * Approximate time Weitetes for front design – for additional support during rubbed against other stones, so that the runner efficient and powerful forward jumps.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.2 out of 5 stars2 ratings3.2 out of 5 stars
